text: THUS joyful Troy maintain'd the Watch of Night,
While Fear, pale Comrade of inglorious Flight,
And heav'n-bred Horror, on the Grecian part,
Sate on each Face, and sadden'd ev'ry heart.
SO held the Troians sleeplesse guard; the Greeks to flight were giuen:
The feeble consort of cold feare (strangely infusde from heauen)
Griefe, not to be endur'd, did wound, all Greeks of greatest worth.
So held the Trojans sleepless guard; the Greeks to flight were giv’n,
The feeble consort of cold fear, strangely infus’d from heav’n;
Grief, not to be endur’d, did wound all Greeks of greatest worth.
Thus kept the Trojans watch, but the Achaeans were holden of wondrous Panic, the handmaid of numbing fear, and with grief intolerable were all the noblest stricken.
So watch’d the Trojan host; but thoughts of flight,
Companions of chill fear, from heaven infused,
Possess’d the Grecians; every leader’s heart
